intro: Persoonia hindii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed geebung, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Proteaceae, which is known for its diverse and often showy floral structures. Persoonia hindii typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and nectar for local wildlife.
